page.title: 17Fishing at Kylesku.
page.content: In 1984, a new fishing jetty was built to boost employment in the area, but fishing at Kylesku was at its best in the 1920s. Then, it is said, it was possible to walk across the boats from one side of the loch to the other. Rowing boats, sailing boats, boats from as far south as the Isle of Man, came to the waters of Loch Glen Coul and Loch Glendhu to fish the herring. The curing of the herring was done at Kylestrome and most of the catch was sent off by sea, although some went by cart to Bonar Bridge. Gradually,the shoals of herring became smaller and smaller until no boats came in. In the late 1960s, The Highlands and Islands Development Board began to encourage prawn fishing in the area. The prawn fishing has had its good times and its bad. At present six boats are fishing from the new jetty.
